meanings.definition: The act of comparing two or more things to assess similarities and differences.
meanings.sent1: Scientists use intercomparisons to see how similar or different the plants are.
meanings.sent2: The intercomparisons between the two cars helped the buyer make a decision.
meanings.sent3: During the intercomparisons of the toys, they found out the teddy bear was the tallest.
meanings.sent4: Her intercomparisons of the two paintings revealed hidden details in each.
meanings.sent5: The intercomparisons of the stars in the sky were like a dance of light and dark.

meanings.definition: A comparison made between different items or groups to evaluate their relative qualities or characteristics.
meanings.sent1: The intercomparisons of the desserts showed which one was the sweetest.
meanings.sent2: Teachers often use intercomparisons to understand the strengths of their students.
meanings.sent3: The intercomparisons of the animals at the zoo led to some unexpected discoveries.
meanings.sent4: His intercomparisons of the books on the shelf revealed the most interesting one.
meanings.sent5: The intercomparisons of the clouds in the sky painted a beautiful picture.
